# ARSkeletonDefinition

**Class**

The hierarchy of joints and their names.

## Declaration

```swift
class ARSkeletonDefinition
```

## Overview

A skeleton definition establishes the relationship of joints that make up a 3D or 2D body’s [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARBody2D/skeleton], in which joints connect to other joints to compose a single skeleton in a parent-child hierarchy. Use [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSkeletonDefinition/parentIndices-82iw2] to identify the hierarchy for a given skeleton definition.

ARKit names particular joints that are crucial to body tracking. You can access named joints by calling [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSkeletonDefinition/indexForJointName:] and passing in one of the available [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSkeletonDefinition/jointNames] identifiers.

## Locating in the Physical Environment

- **neutralBodySkeleton3D**: The 3D skeleton in neutral pose.
- **defaultBody3D**: The default skeleton definition for bodies defined in 3D.

## Locating in Screen Space

- **defaultBody2D**: The default skeleton definition for bodies defined in 2D.

## Getting Joint Information

- **jointNames**: A collection of unique joint names.
- **jointCount**: The skeleton’s total number of joints.
- **index(for:)**: Returns the index for a given joint identifier.
- **parentIndices**: The parent index for each joint.

## Body Data

- **Capturing Body Motion in 3D**: Track a person in the physical environment and visualize their motion by applying the same body movements to a virtual character.
- **ARBody2D**: The screen-space representation of a person ARKit recognizes in the camera feed.
- **ARSkeleton3D**: The skeleton of a human body that ARKit tracks in 3D space.
- **ARSkeleton2D**: An object that describes the locations of a body’s joints in the camera feed.
- **ARSkeleton**: The interface for the skeleton of a tracked body.

## Inherits From

- NSObject
